title: UniPay: Building LATAM’s closed-loop University payments.
summary: Students have digital credentials but no unified payment utility. Campuses need fast, low-cost, verifiable tx. Existing blockchain options remain too slow, costly, or complex for large-scale adoption.
solution: We will migrate Micelya to Cardano with DualDID (QuarkID + Identus/Lace) and add instant closed-loop payments with IFPE compliance, creating a replicable identity-plus-payments model for universities.
proposer_relevant_experience:
Esteban Musso — CEO

Esteban serves as CEO, guiding the strategic direction, business vision, and overall execution of the initiative. With strong experience in leadership and innovation, he manages key partnerships, oversees growth strategies, and ensures the project delivers meaningful social and economic impact.



Guillermo Villanueva — CTO

Guillermo is the Chief Technology Officer and leads the technical architecture of the project. With extensive experience in software development and infrastructure design, he ensures the platform is secure, scalable, and efficient. His technical leadership drives the integration of identity, payments, and financial services into a robust, reliable system.



Fabio Budris — CBO

Fabio is responsible for business development, identifying market opportunities and building strategic alliances with universities, institutions, and partners. He develops sustainable business models and drives adoption, ensuring the solution reaches the communities that need it most.



Celina Villanueva — Product Manager

Celina leads product strategy and execution, ensuring the platform is user-centered, intuitive, and aligned with the project’s goals of identity-driven inclusion and financial access. She oversees product development end-to-end, combining strategic vision with a deep understanding of student and institutional needs.



Anibal Jalaris — Technical Legal Consultant

Anibal provides legal and regulatory guidance, ensuring compliance with data protection, digital identity, financial regulations, and institutional requirements. As both a lawyer and an IT leader, he brings a dual perspective that combines technical depth with legal rigor. His expertise strengthens trust, mitigates regulatory risks, and supports the legal structure essential for deploying payments solutions.



Ailen Díaz — Technical Leader

Ailen is the Technical Leader overseeing backend development, security standards, and system integration. She coordinates the technical team and ensures every component—identity workflows, payments, data handling, and user authentication—meets high standards of reliability and performance.

sub_fields.description: Please provide here more information on the open source status of your project outputs
sub_fields.answer:
Partial open source with strategic IP protection:
Open Source (Apache 2.0/MIT): DualDID integration layer, Cardano payment adapters, L2 integration code, reference docs, tutorials, sample code, and an anonymized university admin dashboard.
Proprietary: Micelya core platform, business logic, QuarkID multi-stack resolution, UI/branding, and production configs.
Rationale: Cardano integrations are open to grow the ecosystem while core logic stays proprietary

sub_fields.title: Category Questions

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
First DualDID Production Implementation



We are the first project deploying interoperable multi-stack SSI at institutional scale. Students hold credentials through both QuarkID (Extrimian’s proven infrastructure) and Identus (Cardano’s enterprise-grade identity framework). This demonstrates that Cardano-based SSI can coexist with existing identity systems—critical for enterprise adoption where institutions operate across multiple blockchain ecosystems.



Integrated Identity + Payments for Institutional Compliance



Current payment solutions don’t integrate verifiable credentials, and existing SSI platforms don’t solve payment utility. We combine both: students verify identity and make instant payments in one platform. Our closed-loop architecture enables regulatory compliance without requiring traditional fintech licensing—leveraging IFPE partners regulated under Mexico’s Fintech Law.



Migration from a Proven Platform (Not Speculative)



Unlike prototypes with zero users, Micelya is already deployed at Universidad Autónoma de Guerrero with active students. We’re not building from scratch—we’re migrating proven infrastructure to Cardano. The project won the ANUIES-TIC 2025 National Award as a leading educational innovation in Mexico, significantly de-risking execution.



Institutional Anchor Model for Scale



We leverage university mandates: students use the wallet for campus services, ensuring guaranteed daily active users. This model can replicate across 200+ universities in the ANUIES network, each adding 10,000–50,000 new Cardano users.



RealFI Validation



This operationalizes RealFI with daily economic activity for underbanked students—financial inclusion through identity-verified payments rather than speculation. Students without bank accounts gain access to digital payments through a compliant, closed-loop campus economy.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP will demonstrate:



Core Functionality:

• DualDID architecture: students hold credentials using QuarkID and Identus

• Interoperable credential verification across DID methods

• Instant payments for campus services (<2s confirmation)

• Closed-loop payment system with regulatory compliance

• Identus-based identity layer embedded in Micelya

• Integration with university enrollment and service systems



Technical Proof Points:

• DID resolution for both did:quarkid and did:prism

• Verifiable credential issuance and verification flows

• Payment routing and settlement in the closed-loop economy

• Admin dashboard for university financial monitoring

• Transaction reconciliation and reporting tools



Regulatory Compliance:

• Closed-loop model minimizing regulatory burden

• IFPE partnership ensuring compliance with Mexico’s Fintech Law

• Extrimian as tech operator; licensed partners manage financial regulation



Access Points:

• Live demo environment (URL upon milestone completion)

• Video walkthroughs showing DualDID + payments

• Technical docs in GitHub wiki

• Testnet deployment with Cardano explorer links

• Beta rollout to UAGro student cohort (Milestone 4)

• Mobile app: Micelya with embedded Identus identity flows (iOS/Android)

• Admin dashboard for university staff

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
On-chain Metrics (Verifiable via Cardano Explorers)



• 100,000+ registered users (wallets with ≥1 credential) by end of 2025

• 20,000+ Daily Active Users (non-payment) by end of 2025

• 2,000+ economically active users (payment pilot) by Q2 2026

• 60,000+ economically active users by end of 2026

• Avg. confirmation time <2s

• Sustained volume through Layer 2 payment infrastructure



Adoption Metrics (UAGro Deployment)



• 60%+ of current Micelya users migrated to Cardano DualDID

• 5+ campus services accepting payments (cafeteria, library, printing, admin fees, events)

• 500+ credentials issued per week (enrollment, grades, payment receipts)



Ecosystem Impact



• 20+ pages of technical documentation

• 5+ developer tutorials

• 3+ conference presentations

• 10+ universities expressing interest (via ANUIES network)



Revenue-Generating Use Cases Enabled



• Instant micropayments for campus services

• Microcredit integration (future milestone)

• Third-party merchant acceptance (local businesses)



Why These Metrics Are Realistic



• Micelya already deployed at UAGro with a proven adoption curve

• Institutional backing ensures large-scale user migration

• Closed-loop architecture minimizes friction for payments adoption

• IFPE partnership ensures compliance under Mexico’s Fintech Law

• ANUIES-TIC award provides credibility and visibility

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Understanding the Problem



Universidad Autónoma de Guerrero (UAGro) has thousands of students using Micelya for digital credentials, but the platform today only solves identity. Students still rely on cash or traditional payment rails for campus transactions.



The challenge is twofold:



Identity without utility: SSI credentials verify identity but don’t enable payments.



Payments without identity: Cash/cards don’t integrate verifiable credentials.



Existing blockchains are too slow for point-of-sale, too expensive for micropayments, and too complex from a regulatory perspective when operating in open-loop financial systems.



Our Approach



We will migrate Micelya from zkSync to Cardano and add instant payments, creating a unified identity + payments platform in a regulatory-compliant closed-loop ecosystem.



Phase 1: DualDID Platform Migration (Months 1–3)



• Migrate Micelya to Cardano using DualDID architecture

• Implement QuarkID + Identus interoperability

• Enable cross-framework credential issuance and verification

• Embed Identus-based identity flows into Micelya

• Deploy Cardano nodes and indexing services

• Maintain backward compatibility with current users and credentials



Phase 2: Closed-Loop Payment Infrastructure (Months 4–6)



• Deploy instant, low-cost payment infrastructure using Cardano Layer 2

• Establish IFPE partnerships for financial compliance

• Implement payment channels for service providers

• Build routing and settlement logic for campus payments

• Create a finance-oriented admin dashboard for UAGro



Phase 3: Service Integration & Economic Activation (Months 7–9)



• Connect campus services to payment rails:

– Cafeteria POS

– Library fees and fines

– Printing and copying

– Administrative fees

– Event ticketing and access control



Phase 4: Production Launch & Documentation (Months 10–12)



• Beta rollout to an initial student cohort (2,000+ economically active users)

• Full production release scaling toward 60,000+ users by end of 2026

• Publish complete DualDID technical documentation

• Create reference implementation guide for other universities

• Publish case study and measurable impact metrics



Why Cardano + DualDID Strategy



Cardano Advantages:

• Identus: mature, enterprise-grade DID framework

• Strong alignment with education and national-scale identity pilots

• Predictable fees for institutional budgeting

• Layer 2 for instant micropayments

• High-assurance design well-suited for compliance contexts



DualDID Benefits:

• Interoperability between QuarkID and Identus

• Combines Extrimian’s proven SSI stack with Cardano-native identity

• Future-proof multi-framework identity architecture

• Establishes multi-stack SSI as a best-practice model for institutions



Regulatory Strategy:

Closed-loop payments reduce regulatory burden while maintaining full compliance.

Extrimian acts as technology provider; licensed IFPE partners handle all regulated financial operations under Mexico’s Fintech Law.



Why This Matters



This project bridges real gaps:

• Blockchain → daily utility at student scale

• Identity → economic activity

• Theory → production deployment for 100,000+ users

• Single deployment → replicable reference for Latin America



Success proves Cardano can support institutional-scale applications integrating identity and payments—core to global RealFI adoption.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Quantifiable Impact

Immediate (Year 1 – 2025)



User Adoption:

• 100,000+ registered users (wallets with credentials)

• 20,000+ Daily Active Users (non-payment)

• 2,000+ economically active users by Q2 2026

• 5+ institutional service providers integrated



Developer Ecosystem:

• 20+ pages of technical documentation

• 5+ open-source repositories (DualDID integrations, L2 adapters)

• 5+ developer tutorials/workshops

• Reference architecture for DualDID implementations



Network Activity:

• Sustained Layer 2 payment transaction volume

• Diverse transaction types (credentials + payments)

• Expansion across LATAM education sector

• First closed-loop payment ecosystem on Cardano



Medium-Term (Year 2 – 2026)



Institutional Expansion:

• 60,000+ economically active users at UAGro

• 3–5 additional Mexican universities onboarded

• 200,000+ potential users across Mexico

• 2+ LATAM universities adopting reference implementation



Qualitative Impact



Proof Points for Cardano:

• Enterprise-grade deployment at institutional scale

• Regulatory-compliant closed-loop payment model for education

• Integration with legacy university systems (ERP, finance, SIS)

• DualDID demonstrating multi-stack SSI interoperability (QuarkID + Identus)



RealFI Validation:

• Students without bank accounts gain access to digital payments

• Identity-integrated compliance through verifiable credentials

• University participation strengthens institutional trust



Ecosystem Strengthening:

• Reusable DualDID components support future SSI projects

• Closed-loop payment toolkit applicable to other institutions

• Case study attracts new enterprise projects to Cardano

• Media visibility grows Cardano presence in LATAM



Sharing Value Back to Cardano



We commit to:



Open-sourcing critical components:

DualDID integration layers, QuarkID–Identus interoperability modules, and closed-loop payment adapters.



Publishing comprehensive documentation:

Architecture rationale, regulatory compliance framework, and lessons from a 100K+ user deployment.



Active community engagement:

Talks at Cardano Summit and LATAM events, developer AMAs, and community sessions on institutional adoption.



Transparent Catalyst reporting:

Monthly progress reports, public metrics dashboards, and video demos.



Collaboration with the ecosystem:

Sharing learnings and working with Identus teams and other SSI/payment projects on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our Track Record

Proven Products in Production



Micelya Platform:

• Deployed at Universidad Autónoma de Guerrero with a growing user base

• Currently operating on zkSync with proven transaction volumes

• Winner of ANUIES-TIC National Award (2024) as leading educational innovation in Mexico

• 99.9%+ uptime ensuring credential accessibility

• Demonstrated product–market fit in an institutional context



QuarkID Protocol:

• Open-source SSI infrastructure powering Micelya

• DWN-based implementation enabling data sovereignty

• Production-grade credential issuance and verification

• Fully interoperable with W3C VC and DID standards



Technical Team Expertise



Core Team:

• 30+ years combined experience in blockchain, cryptography, and ZKPs

• Deep expertise in Self-Sovereign Identity architecture and protocols

• Proven delivery of institutional-scale blockchain applications

• Mobile and web development for high-traffic fintech systems



Strategic Partnerships



Universidad Autónoma de Guerrero (UAGro):

• Signed contract for operations and expansion

• Institutional commitment guaranteeing deployment continuity

• Collaboration with university IT department for system integrations



Identus / Cardano Identity Ecosystem:

• Incorporation of Identus identity flows alongside QuarkID

• Access to technical guidance within the Cardano identity ecosystem



IFPE Partners (in negotiation):

• Licensed institutions under Mexico’s Fintech Law

• Ensure financial regulatory compliance for closed-loop payments

• Add financial services expertise to Extrimian’s technology stack



Cardano Ecosystem Integration



This is our first implementation on Cardano, but the team has deep multi-chain experience (zkSync, Web3 SSI frameworks) and strong alignment with the Identus identity stack.



Our background includes:

• Production deployments using digital identity standards

• Expertise in cryptographic primitives and ZK systems

• Institutional-scale blockchain rollouts

• Ability to navigate technical and compliance complexity in real environments



This significantly de-risks the Cardano migration.



Validation & Feasibility

Technical Validation



Migration Strategy:

• Dual-deployment approach: zkSync remains operational during Cardano rollout

• DualDID architecture (QuarkID + Identus) provides redundancy and interoperability

• Phased user migration allows real-world validation before full transition

• Cardano identity ecosystem support for Identus integration



Closed-loop Payment System:

• Reduces complexity compared to open-loop models

• Predictable transaction patterns (campus services, known participants)

• Regulatory clarity through IFPE partnerships



Risk Mitigation:

• Active user base already familiar with Micelya UX

• University IT team supports integrations

• Cardano identity stack guidance reduces technical uncertainty

• IFPE partners handle regulated financial operations



Market Validation



Existing User Base:

• Thousands already onboarded to Micelya

• Strong engagement on current credential-based workflows

• Documented demand for integrated payments

• Institutional commitment from UAGro leadership



Economic Model:

• University covers infrastructure (sustainable post-grant)

• Closed-loop system generates transaction-based revenue

• Service providers reduce payment processing costs

• Students gain access to digital payments without needing bank accounts



Why We Will Succeed



• Not building from scratch — migrating a proven platform

• Existing users — adoption risk is minimal

• Strong institutional backing — UAGro contract ensures deployment

• Cardano identity ecosystem — Identus reduces integration risk

• Team expertise — production-grade blockchain + SSI experience

• Clear regulatory pathway — IFPE partners cover compliance

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: DualDID Infrastructure & Initial Integration

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
Deploy Cardano infrastructure and implement DualDID architecture



• Cardano mainnet and testnet nodes deployed and fully operational

• DualDID architecture implemented using QuarkID + Identus

• DID resolution functioning for both did:quarkid and did:prism

• Test credentials issued and verified on the Cardano testnet

• Identus-based identity flows embedded into Micelya (initial version)

• Development and staging environments fully operational

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
• Cardano node operational with 99.9% uptime over a 30-day monitoring period

• DID resolution successful for 100+ test DIDs across did:quarkid and did:prism

• Credential issuance flow completing in <30 seconds end-to-end

• Identus-based identity flows embedded in Micelya interface (basic functionality)

• API endpoints responding with <2 seconds latency

• Automated tests passing for all core DualDID identity functions

sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone Evidence Package



• Screenshots of Cardano node sync status and uptime metrics

• Public DID resolver endpoints demonstrating QuarkID and Identus resolution

• Video demonstration of the DualDID credential issuance and verification flow

• GitHub repository with infrastructure code and deployment scripts

• Published API documentation describing the DualDID architecture

• Demo video showing Identus-based identity flows integrated into Micelya

sub_fields.title: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.description: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.answer:
Esteban Musso — CEO

Esteban serves as CEO, guiding the strategic direction, business vision, and overall execution of the initiative. With strong experience in leadership and innovation, he manages key partnerships, oversees growth strategies, and ensures the project delivers meaningful social and economic impact.



Guillermo Villanueva — CTO

Guillermo is the Chief Technology Officer and leads the technical architecture of the project. With extensive experience in software development and infrastructure design, he ensures the platform is secure, scalable, and efficient. His technical leadership drives the integration of identity, payments, and financial services into a robust, reliable system.



Fabio Budris — CBO

Fabio is responsible for business development, identifying market opportunities and building strategic alliances with universities, institutions, and partners. He develops sustainable business models and drives adoption, ensuring the solution reaches the communities that need it most.



Celina Villanueva — Product Manager

Celina leads product strategy and execution, ensuring the platform is user-centered, intuitive, and aligned with the project’s goals of identity-driven inclusion and financial access. She oversees product development end-to-end, combining strategic vision with a deep understanding of student and institutional needs.



Anibal Jalaris — Technical Legal Consultant

Anibal provides legal and regulatory guidance, ensuring compliance with data protection, digital identity, financial regulations, and institutional requirements. As both a lawyer and an IT leader, he brings a dual perspective that combines technical depth with legal rigor. His expertise strengthens trust, mitigates regulatory risks, and supports the legal structure essential for deploying payments solutions.



Ailen Díaz — Technical Leader

Ailen is the Technical Leader overseeing backend development, security standards, and system integration. She coordinates the technical team and ensures every component—identity workflows, payments, data handling, and user authentication—meets high standards of reliability and performance.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 1: DualDID Infrastructure (₳45,000)

• Infrastructure setup (nodes, deployment, monitoring).

• DualDID architecture (QuarkID + Identus integration).

• Identus identity-flow embedding and initial integration into Micelya.

• Testing, documentation, iteration.

Milestone 2: Payment Infrastructure (₳50,000)

• Layer 2 payment infrastructure development.

• Closed-loop system architecture and routing.

• Load + security testing infrastructure.

• Documentation and monitoring tools.

Milestone 3: Campus Integration (₳45,000)

• Service provider integrations (APIs, POS systems.

• Admin dashboard and reporting tools.

• Reconciliation and financial workflows.

• Training materials + documentation.

• Integration testing with UAGro.

Milestone 4: Beta Launch (₳35,000)

• Beta program management + onboarding.

• User support infrastructure.

• Marketing and onboarding materials.

• Bug fixes, iteration, QA.

• Mainnet infrastructure scaling.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
For ₳175,000, Cardano ecosystem receives: • 100,000+ registered users (production deployment, not pilot) • 60,000+ economically active users by 2026 • First DualDID production implementation (QuarkID + Identus) • Closed-loop payment regulatory framework • Open-source components and 20+ pages of documentation • 2+ developer workshops and ecosystem training



User Acquisition Cost: • Cost per registered user: 1.75 ADA (~$3.50) • Industry benchmark: $50-100 per crypto user acquisition • We deliver at 93-96% lower cost than market



Leverage Ratio: Extrimian contributes significant in-kind resources: • Existing Micelya platform and codebase: ~$200K value • QuarkID protocol infrastructure: ~$100K value • UAGro partnership and relationship management: ~$50K value • Executive oversight and business development: ~$55K value



Total project value: ~$615,000 Catalyst share: ~$350,000 (₳175,000 @ $2/ADA) Leverage: 1.76x (for every $1 from Catalyst, Extrimian contributes $0.76)



Strategic Value: • Reference implementation replicable to 200+ Mexican universities • Each university replication: 10,000-50,000 new Cardano users • Potential 100-1000x multiplier on Catalyst investment • RealFI validation attracting institutional projects to Cardano • Competitive demonstration (projects migrating TO Cardano)



Risk Profile: • Platform already built (execution risk: VERY LOW) • Users already exist (adoption risk: LOW) • Signed contracts (institutional risk: VERY LOW) 



This isn't speculative development—it's strategic migration of validated infrastructure to Cardano, with institutional backing and proven team execution.

sub_fields.title: I confirm that evidence of prior research, whitepaper, design, or proof-of-concept is provided.
sub_fields.description: Foundational Work:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes ecosystem research and uses the findings to either (a) justify its uniqueness over existing solutions or (b) demonstrate the value of its novel approach.
sub_fields.description: Ecosystem Value Proposition:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal demonstrates technical capability via verifiable in-house talent or a confirmed development partner (GitHub, LinkedIn, portfolio, etc.)
sub_fields.description: Builder Credentials:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposer and all team members are in good standing with prior Catalyst projects.
sub_fields.description: Catalyst Standing:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal clearly defines the problem and the value of the on-chain utility.
sub_fields.description: Problem & Use Case:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the primary goal of the proposal is a working prototype deployed on at least a Cardano testnet.
sub_fields.description: Tangible Prototype:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal outlines a credible and clear technical plan and architecture.
sub_fields.description: Technical Approach:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget and timeline (≤ 12 months) are realistic for the proposed work.
sub_fields.description: Realistic Scope:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes a community engagement and feedback plan to amplify prototype adoption with the Cardano ecosystem.
sub_fields.description: Community Engagement:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget is for future development only; excludes retroactive funding, incentives, giveaways, re-granting, or sub-treasuries.
sub_fields.description: Budget Compliance:

sub_fields.title: I Agree
sub_fields.description: I confirm that I have read, understand and shall adhere to the [Project Catalyst Platform Terms of Use](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-terms-of-use), [Project Catalyst Platform Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-privacy-policy), [Terms & Conditions](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions), [Fund Rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules), [Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/catalyst-fc-privacy-policy). I understand that providing accurate and truthful information is essential for my proposal to remain eligible to participate in the current Fund.
